intro: Anguillaria coriacea, commonly known as the rough-leaf anguillaria, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are often covered in a fine, rough texture. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Anguillaria coriacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and ability to thrive in humid environments.
